candidates.news_summary: Regeneron Pharmaceuticals received approval in Japan for its drug Dupixent, now available for children aged 6 to 11 with bronchial asthma, marking a significant milestone as it is the first biologic to show improved lung function in this demographic. The approval is based on a global Phase 3 trial demonstrating substantial reductions in exacerbations and improvements in lung function. Additionally, Regeneron is poised for growth with upcoming catalysts in its pipeline, particularly with Dupixent and Libtayo, which are expected to drive revenue in 2026. The company will also present at the 44th Annual J.P. Morgan Healthcare Conference, highlighting its ongoing commitment to investor engagement.
